Task: Write a termination letter to employee to communicate layoff.

Prompt.pre_question_prompt: I am an expert in communicating layoffs to employees. I will ask some questions to collect information and then I will use the information to write a termination letter that communicates to an employee that they will be laid off.
Prompt.task_specific_prompt: Write a termination letter that communicates to an employee that they will be laid off using the questions and answers above.

QApair.Question: What is the name of the employee being laid off?
What is the position of the employee being laid off?
When will the employee be laid off?
QApair.Answer: The employee will be laid off on January 21, 2022.

QApair.Question: What is the reason for the layoff?
QApair.Answer: The layoff is due to financial losses from COVID-19.

QApair.Question: What are the severance benefits being offered to the employee?
QApair.Answer: The employee will receive two weeks of severance pay and their health insurance coverage will be extended for another 18 months.

QApair.Question: Is there anything else you would like to include in the letter?
QApair.Answer: This is layoff is permanent, but we have resources to help the employee find another job.

QApair.Question: Would you like me to draft the letter for you?
Would you like me to send the letter to the employee?
QApair.Answer: Yes, I would like you to send the letter to them.

QApair.Question: What is the employee's mailing address?
What is the employee's email address?
What is the employee's phone number?

Instances.Output:
Dear Kaylee,

I regret to inform you that you will be laid off from your position as Sales Associate effective January 21, 2022. This layoff is due to financial losses from COVID-19.

You will receive two weeks of severance pay and your health insurance coverage will be extended for another 18 months. This is layoff is permanent, but we have resources to help you find another job.

If you have any questions, please do not hesitate to contact me.

Sincerely,

Your Name

Dear Mike Tracy,

I regret to inform you that you will be laid off from your position as Sales Manager, effective June 1, 2019. This is due to a decline in sales.

Each employee will receive two weeks of severance pay for every year they have been with the company, up to a maximum of 26 weeks. There is an opportunity for employees to be rehired at a later date if there is an upturn in market performance.

All remaining employees will report to Jennifer Wild instead.

If you have any questions, please don't hesitate to contact me.

Sincerely,

Sandra Smith
Head of HR
